summary: Retrieve all properties of a global product that is in the "DRAFT", "UNPUBLISHED", or "PUBLISHED" status, and the corresponding local product IDs in the published markets
description:
Retrieve all properties of a global product that is in the "DRAFT", "UNPUBLISHED", or "PUBLISHED" status, and the corresponding local product IDs in the published markets.​ Version
202309
  
API Testing Tool
​

query.description: Every single app will have a unique key. Please use the specific key assigned to your app.​
Signature generated by gen algorithm. When you send API requests to TTS, you must sign them so that TTS can identify the senders. ​
Unix timestamp GMT (UTC+00:00). This timestamp is used across all API requests. Developers can use this convert to local time.​

header.description: The seller access_token value from Get Access Token, when user_type = 0. Follow this guide to get seller access_token.​

schema.description: The success or failure status code returned in API response.​
The success or failure messages returned in API response. Reasons of failure will be described in the message.​

children.description: The global product ID in TikTok Shop.​
The product title. ​
A list of images to display in the product image gallery.​
The image height.​ Unit: px​
The image width.​ Unit: px​
The URI of the image.​
Product video information.​
The video ID.​
The product description in HTML format.​
The dimensions of the product package.​
The package length.​
The package width.​
The package height.​
The unit for the package dimensions.​
The weight of the product package.​
The package weight.​
The unit for the package weight.​
The list of certifications for your product.​
The ID to identify the type of certification required for the product category.​
The title of the certification type.​
A list of certification related files.​
The ID of the certification file.​
The URLs to view the certification files.​ ​
The name of the certification file​
The format of the certification file.​
A list of certification related images.​
The image height.​ Unit: px​
The image width.​ Unit: px​
The URI of the image. ​
A list of global Stock Keeping Units (SKUs) used to identify distinct variants of the product.​
The global SKU ID in TikTok Shop.​
An internal code/name for managing SKUs, not visible to buyers. ​

The SKU's global uniform pre-tax price that serves as the baseline for calculating the local prices across different markets.​ ​ Note: ​ - Upon publishing, this price will be automatically converted to the local pre-tax price and local display price based on market-specific exchange rates and applicable charges such as shipping costs, taxes, and other fees.​ - The auto-conversion will exclude JP and US shops using China warehouses.​
The price amount.​
The currency.​ Possible values:​ - USD: Applicable for global sellers​ - EUR: Applicable for intra-EU sellers​

The unit price of the SKU. ​ You can display the unit price to facilitate easier price comparisons across different products and packaging sizes.​ Applicable only for the EU market.​ ​ Note: ​ - This value is available only if you have defined the elements used to calculate this price when creating the product.​ - Unit price = Selling price/(SKU unit count/base unit count)​

The total SKU inventory quantity across all shops globally. ​ ​ The inventory for each local shop is automatically calculated when a product is first published. After publishing, this global quantity cannot be manually changed. You can only modify the inventory quantity in each local shop.​
A regulated identifier code assigned to a product based on international standardized regulations (e.g. GTIN) to ensure the product is universally identifiable across various platforms and systems.​
The identifier code.​
The type of identifier code.​ Possible values:​ - GTIN​ - EAN​ - UPC​ - ISBN​ - JAN​
A list of attributes (e.g. size, color, length) that define each variant of a product.​
The sales attribute ID.​
The sales attribute name.​
The sales attribute value ID.​
The sales attribute value name.​
An image to display for the SKU.​
The image height.​ Unit: px​
The image width.​ Unit: px​
The URLs to view the image thumbnails.​
The URI of the image.​
The URLs to view the images.​
SKU inventory information per warehouse.​
The ID of the global warehouse where the SKU is stored. ​
The SKU quantity available in the warehouse.​

The total quantity/volume of the product represented by the SKU.​ For example, if the SKU represents 500ml of water, this value would be 500 if the unit type is defined as ml.​ Applicable only for the EU market.​ ​ Note: ​ - This is mainly used to calculate the unit price of the SKU, and is required only if you wish to display the unit price to facilitate easier price comparisons across different products and packaging sizes.​ - Unit price = Selling price/(SKU unit count/base unit count). Therefore if you want to obtain the unit price, you would also need to define the "base unit count" and the "unit type" product attributes. Retrieve the relevant information for these product attributes by using the Get Global Attributes API.​

If the SKU is a combined listing (in other words, a product bundle) containing multiple individual SKUs, you can add up to 10 additional identifier codes here for the SKUs included in the bundle. Delimit the codes with commas.​ ​ Format:​ GTIN: 14 digits ​ EAN: 8, 13, or 14 digits ​ UPC: 12 digits ​ ISBN: 13 digits (supports 'X' in uppercase as the last digit)​ ​ Note: ​ - Applicable only for the EU market. ​ - The identifier code must be unique for each SKU, with no repetition allowed.​
An external identifier used in an external ecommerce platform. This is used to associate the SKU between TikTok Shop and the external ecommerce platform.​
The time when the product is last updated.​ Unix timestamp.​
The time when the product is created.​ Unix timestamp.​
A list of general attributes (e.g. manufacturer, country of origin, materials used) that describe the product as a whole, regardless of variant.​
The ID of the product attribute.​
The product attribute name.​
A list of selectable values for the product attribute.​
The product attribute value ID.​
The product attribute value name.​
The measurement details of the product to help buyers find the right size.​
An image of the size chart.​
The image height.​ Unit: px​
The image width.​ Unit: px​
The URI of the image. ​
A TikTok Shop size chart template generated by the size chart tool in Seller Center > Manage Products > Bulk action > Batch manage size charts.​
The size chart template ID.​
The local products associated through global product publishing or manual binding.​
The market where the local product is listed.​
The local product ID.​
The list of sku mappings between the global and local products.​
The global SKU ID in TikTok Shop.​
The local SKU ID in TikTok Shop.​
The list of sales attribute mappings between the global and local SKUs.​
The global sales attribute ID.​
The local sales attribute ID.​
The global sales attribute value ID.​
The local sales attribute value ID.​
The cross-border seller ID.​
Product brand information.​
The ID of the brand of this product.​
The category of the product.​
The category ID.​

(Deprecated: This field is deprecated and will be removed in a future API version. Use manufacturer_ids instead.)​ ​ The product manufacturer's details.​ If there are more than one manufacturer information, only the first-added manufacturer will be returned in this field.​
The name of the manufacturer.​
The address of the manufacturer. ​
The phone number of the manufacturer. ​
The email address of the manufacturer. ​
A comma-delimited list of responsible person IDs. Retrieve the IDs from the Search Responsible Persons API.​ Note: Applicable only for the EU market in certain categories.​
A comma-delimited list of manufacturer IDs. Retrieve the IDs from the Search Manufacturers API.​ Note: Applicable only for the EU market in certain categories.​

The BCP-47 locale code representing the source language used for specifying the product information.​ Default: en-US​ Possible values:​ - de-DE​ - en-IE​ - es-ES​ - fr-FR​ - it-IT​ ​ Note: Applicable only for intra-EU sellers.​
An external identifier used in an external ecommerce platform. This is used to associate the product between TikTok Shop and the external ecommerce platform.​

error_codes.message: You can't edit other sellers' products.​
